intro: Melanthium aethiopicum, commonly known as the Ethiopian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Melanthium aethiopicum is noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
